findings.title: Phishing Attack on Proxy
findings.description: An attacker can phish users to execute arbitrary code on their Proxy, resulting in fund theft.

findings.title: Can the user’s proxy be self-destructed?
findings.description: The use of `delegatecall` in the DSProxy could result in the proxy being self-destroyed and losing funds.

findings.title: Can an attacker abuse deviations from Maker’s mainnet proxy and Liquity’s Proxy?
findings.description: Abuse of deviations between Maker's mainnet proxy and Liquity's Proxy may lead to potential security risks

findings.title: Delegatecall Misuse in DSProxy
findings.description: High-severity issues due to `delegatecall` usage in DSProxy may lead to self-destruction and fund loss.

findings.title: Unsynchronized Dependencies
findings.description: Low-severity issues involve dependencies that were copy-pasted in their entirety rather than imported externally, which makes it difficult to keep them in sync with upstream patches which might otherwise fix known vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Lack of data validation on external user arguments
findings.description: Arguments provided by external users are not validated, which may result in a loss of user funds.

findings.title: Lack of Events for Monitoring
findings.description: An informational issue was raised regarding the lack of events for functions in the script, which would be beneficial to have for monitoring purposes as these scripts increase in complexity.

findings.title: Publicly Visible Scripts
findings.description: Scripts being publicly visible could make it easier for attackers to write exploits to abuse the Liquity Protocol.

findings.title: Revert when LUSD amount is 0
findings.description: One minor code-quality issue was raised to revert when the LUSD amount is 0.

findings.title: Arbitrary Script Execution due to Lack of Contract Existence Check
findings.description: The contracts contained no assembly usage, but a lack of contract existence check on the proxy and opportunity for arbitrary script execution that could result in a loss of user funds.

findings.title: Missing Test for Proxy Owner Execution
findings.description: The function claimCollateralAndOpenTrove lacks a test to verify that only a proxy owner can call it to execute code.
